refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetch a row as an object

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: pg_fetch_object is similar to pg_fetch_array, with one difference - an object is returned, instead of an array. Indirectly, that means that you can only access the data by the field names, and not by their offsets (numbers are illegal property names).
row is row (record) number to be retrieved. First row is 0.
Speed-wise, the function is identical to pg_fetch_array, and almost as quick as pg_fetch_row (the difference is insignificant).

note.para: From 4.3.0, result_type is default to PGSQL_ASSOC while older versions' default was PGSQL_BOTH. There is no use for numeric property, since numeric property name is invalid in PHP.
result_type may be deleted in future versions.
